page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {CIRENCESTER PARK.} THE PARK IS SET OUT IN A SERIES OF AVENUES.{THE BROAD AVENUE RUNS FROM {CIRENCESTER TO SAPPERTON FOR SOME SIX {MILES AND IS THE LONGEST IN BRITAIN. THIS IS CROSSED BY THE TEN RIDES. THERE ARE OVER SIXTY MILES OF GRASS RIDES . THE WOODLAND LANDSCAPE HAS CHANGED LITTLE SINCE IT WAS FIRST PLANTED. THE HARDWOOS,{SYCAMORE, ASH AND BEECH}GROW NATURALLY. ALTHOUGH FAMOUS FOR ITS BEECHES,{LARCH, SCOTS PINE AND SPRUCE} ARE PLANTED AMONG THE HARDWOODS TO CONTINUE THE MIXED PLANTATIONS OF THE ORIGINAL PLAN. TWO FOLLIES WERE BUILT.ONE WAS {POPE'S SEAT A 'RUSTICATED BUILDING'} TYPICAL OF THE TIMES.IT WAS A STONE SUMMER HOUSE CONSTRUCTED AT THE JUNCTION SO THAT THE VIEW DOWN THE SEVEN RIDES COULD BE ENJOYED.
